722303f-c.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street
722303f-c.text:
Park Avenue, at East 6lst Street as viewed north-
eastward from atop the Grolier Society Clubhouse (47-49 E.6D
Street) and across the cleared Brearley School site (S. W.
corner of 6lst Street) to show mainly the 15 and 12 story
apartment houses thst are respectively, No's. 535 8555 Park
Avenue. These occupy the east frontage, from 61st to 62nd
Streets.
View No.1 emphasizes tho 12 story building (No. 540)
at the N. W. corner of 61st Street and is photographed from
the same point of vantage.
May 13, 1930
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTONS

722296f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street (East)
722296f-a.text:
Park Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 60th Street, showing Christ Church
(new edifice for the former Madison Ave. M.E. Church which stood at the
N.E. corner of Madison Ave. and East 60th Street).
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722290f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street (East)
722290f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, north from East 80th St.,
showing the cleared 60th-6lst Street frontage and apartment
buildings north of same. The prominent 12 story white structure
is No. 540 Park Avenue (erected 1908) and is at the N. W. corner
of E. 61st Street. Adjotning to the north is the 17 story
anartment building, No. 550 Park Ave., a structure over shadow-
ing the Colonial facaded Colony Club.
December 21, 1930
Views 1,2
. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

722299f-c.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street (East)
722299f-c.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from East 60th (left) to
6lst (right) Streets, showing an entire blockfront clearance.
The photographer is viewfng generally westward towards 5th
Ave. and where (in Views 1\&2) appear the Hotels Savoy Plaza
and the Sherry Netherland. View 3 shows the southeasterly
side of the Grolter Society Club building.
Chrit Church (M. E.) will rise at the southerly
Palf of this site and the balcnce will not be erected upon
until 1940. For further data see other views.
Tecember 21, 1930
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRDI:TI01S

722291f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street (East)
722291f-b.text:
Park Avenue, at East 60th Street, showing
two corners of same as viered eastward on the street
and across the Avenue. The cleared site will be im-
proved with the new Chriat Church. The apartment
building hown is No. 521 Park (erected 1911) and is
at the N.W. corner. The Grolier Socfety Clubhouse is
at the left, tho darkly shown.
December 21, 1930
P. L. Srerr
NO RICPEGDUCTIONS

714066f.title: Manhattan: 60th Street (East) - Park Avenue
714066f.text:
106-112 East 60th Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of
Park Avenue.
About 1915.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

722298f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street
722298f-a.text:
Pnrk Avenue, west side, from E. 60th to 6lst Streets,
showing Christ Church (M. E. ) and the Park Avenue Tennis
Club. The church, a new edifice of the congregation of
the Madison Avenue M. E. Church is at the N. W. corner of
60th Street and replaced an apartment house (erected in
1911 and demolished in 1930). The tennis courts are where
the Brearley School formerly stood (also cleared in 1930).
Upon this site (N. Y. Times of Jan. 18, 1940) will rise
a 19 story apartment house. Note the Savoy Plaza Hotel
in the center background.
Aukust 13, 1936
P. L. Sperr
NO REgPRODIPTI5NS

722295f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street (East)
722295f-a.text:
Park Ave., east side, south from, but not including East 60th Street.
Prominent building shown, is the Rits Tower.
June 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722292f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 60th Street
722292f-a.text:
Park Avenue, south from :nd including 60th Street, showing east
aide of Avenue.
Conpare with Galloway's picture of the same view but taken neerer
the ground, in 1930.
1923-1924.
Ewing Galloway,Photoarapher.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
